result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane A. McNamar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Restitution shall be determined within 30 days.
Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant shall write a letter of apology to the victims due within 30 days of plea and sentencing to be preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall undergo any counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall complete his GED/HSED or high school diploma through the Medford Adult Academy.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and comply with any treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
The jail sentence shall begin no later than September 17, 2016 at 4:30 pm.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

records.addlTxt: of Conviction
Restitution Summary
Letter to Court fromVictim Witness Coordinator
In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shane A. McNamar appeared in person with his Attorney Wright Laufenberg.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights have been complied with.  The State moves to amend Count 1 to dismiss the enhancer for arming self with dangerous weapon.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Counts 1, 3, 5 and 7.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1, 3, 5 and 7.  Court dismisses and read in the remaining counts.  Statement by Counsel.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders on count 1 - withheld sentence probation for 5 years with the conditions of 9 months county jail with huber to begin no later than September 17, 2016 at 4:30 pm; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA and comply with treatment recommendations; restitution joint and several; restitution to be determined within 30 days and defense has two weeks after restitution is determined to object; letter of apology to the victims due within 30 days of plea and sentencing and preapproved by probation; any other counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; complete his GED/SHSED or high school diploma through the Medford adult academy.  Count 3 - withheld sentence probation for 3 years with same conditions as count 1 except there is no jail.  Count 5 - withheld sentence probation for 3 years with same conditions as count 1 except there is no jail.  Count 7 - withheld sentence probation for 2 years with same conditions as count 1 except there is no jail.  Appeal rights signed by defendant.  - rt

Defendant Shane A. McNamar in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed its standard motions.  Defense has not filed any motions.  No objection by defense regarding state's motions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.  - rt
Motion hearing on May 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Written

Court calls case Nos. 15CF82, 15CF83, 15CF84, 15CF85, 15CF87 and 15CF90.  Defendant Shane A. McNamar in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of preliminary hearing filed - based on waiver court bound DE over for trial.  Information filed by the state.  DE waived further reading of same and entered pleas of not guilty to all the charges.   Atty Laufenberg requests to file motions for discovery and to file motions. Court grants requests.   State filed motion to revoke bond on all cases.  Argument.  15CF82 - Court orders $5,000.00 cash be forfeited. 15CF83 - Court orders $500.00 cash be forfeited.  Court will not forfeit signature bonds at this time.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm. ba

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared by video in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $10,000.00 cash bond with conditions of: booking; no contact with P.J.W., D.A., T.W., E.B.; not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription. Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.  Initial appearance set for November 17, 2015 at 1:00 p.m. - ba
